title: Diaper Shorts Are Back - How to Shop the Controversial TikTok Trend
description: Of all the street style trends to dominate our FYP and social media feeds in recent years, bloomer shorts seems to be the most bizarre (and ironically one of our top favorites) yet. And who do we have to thank for it? TikTok, of course. In a single scroll on the popular app, you've probably come across the piece multiple times, from those viral Miu Miu briefs to Aritzia's more affordable offerings. Slightly more flirty and risqu√© than the stomach pudge dress or the fisherman aesthetic, bloomer shorts (aka "diaper shorts") have officially made it to the top of the sartorial food chain. What Are Bloomer Shorts? While the idea of bloomer shorts may seem new or daunting at first, they're far from groundbreaking. Similarly to most trends, the good ol' "everything is new again" concept applies here, as the fad dates back to 1850 when the silhouette was invented as a practical solution for women's health and comfort - eventually grabbing the attention of famed suffragette Amelia Bloomer. It wasn't long before she published her approval of them in her newspaper "The Lily," advocating for women to have the freedom to wear what they want. They became controversial since they exposed women's ankles, though they were cut midi-length, directly challenging the gender norms of that time. Fast forward to present day, and bloomers are still a hot topic of conversation. Aritzia recently released a pair of gray micro shorts that dominated TikTok because of the gathered hem that resembles a diaper. Some users are completely obsessed, while others have expressed their disapproval with comments such as, "That's grandma's undergarments" and "It's recession time." Although the trouser is polarizing, it shows how much bloomer shorts have evolved. Even celebrities like Dua Lipa, Sydney Sweeney, and Anya Taylor-Joy have worn the statement piece, from sporty versions to classic denim styles, showcasing the trend's versatility. @notkaiagrantt I love aritizia. Of all the street style trends to dominate our FYP and social media feeds in recent years, bloomer shorts seems to be the most bizarre (and ironically one of our top favorites) yet. And who do we have to thank for it? TikTok, of course. In a single scroll on the popular app, you've probably come across the piece multiple times, from those viral Miu Miu briefs to Aritzia's more affordable offerings. Slightly more flirty and risqu√© than the stomach pudge dress or the fisherman aesthetic, bloomer shorts (aka "diaper shorts") have officially made it to the top of the sartorial food chain.

What Are Bloomer Shorts?

While the idea of bloomer shorts may seem new or daunting at first, they're far from groundbreaking. Similarly to most trends, the good ol' "everything is new again" concept applies here, as the fad dates back to 1850 when the silhouette was invented as a practical solution for women's health and comfort ‚Äî eventually grabbing the attention of famed suffragette Amelia Bloomer. It wasn't long before she published her approval of them in her newspaper "The Lily," advocating for women to have the freedom to wear what they want. They became controversial since they exposed women's ankles, though they were cut midi-length, directly challenging the gender norms of that time.

Fast forward to present day, and bloomers are still a hot topic of conversation. Aritzia recently released a pair of gray micro shorts that dominated TikTok because of the gathered hem that resembles a diaper. Some users are completely obsessed, while others have expressed their disapproval with comments such as, "That's grandma's undergarments" and "It's recession time." Although the trouser is polarizing, it shows how much bloomer shorts have evolved. Even celebrities like Dua Lipa, Sydney Sweeney, and Anya Taylor-Joy have worn the statement piece, from sporty versions to classic denim styles, showcasing the trend's versatility.

Whether you're looking to upgrade your summer wardrobe or you're curious about the unique trend, keep scrolling to shop our bloomer shorts guide.

Best Affordable Bloomer Shorts

Nufiwi Lolita Bloomers ($15-$21)

Although designers like Miu Miu and Jacquemus have successfully nailed the trend with their offerings, you can get the same vibe for a fraction of the price. This frilly pair from Amazon has such fun details, like a dainty bow and ruffle layers. These also start at just $15, making it an easy purchase.

Best Lounge Bloomer Shorts

Beverly and Beck Tie Front Bloomer Shorts ($18, originally $30)

Bloomers aren't just meant to be worn outside, but can also be styled around the house. We love this piece's gathered hem and contrast tie-front waist. Whether you need a stylish find for bed or want a comfortable bottom for your work-from-home outfit, you'll never want to take these shorts off.

Best Bubble Bloomer Shorts

Asos Design Bubble Hem Bloomer Shorts ($38)

There's nothing like a trendy find that keeps your style modern, yet classic. This minimally chic pair from Asos features a stripe print and high-rise waist, making them a figure-flattering go-to.

Best Butter Yellow Bloomer Shorts

Akira Shake It Baby Ruffle Short ($49)

If you're a fan of the butter yellow aesthetic, you'll love these ruffle shorts from Akira. With a stretchy floral lace fabrication, high-rise elastic waistband, bow appliqu√©, and scalloped trim, this pair offers a perfectly feminine way to nail this trend.

Best Dainty Bloomer Shorts

Edikted Lona Bloomer Shorts ($50)

These dainty yet casual bloomers are a such a playful way to nail the trend. The delicate scalloped hem and soft pink hue allow endless styling opportunities, from a baby tee with socks and heels to a cropped graphic T-shirt and sneakers.

Best White Bloomer Shorts

Sunday Best Souffle Poplin Short ($78)

While the controversial Aritzia pair from TikTok aren't currently available to shop, these white shorts are too stylish to turn down. The gathered waist and hem contour to your body without looking bulky, giving you a polished yet whimsical look.

Best Printed Bloomer Shorts

Frankies Bikinis Cider Bloomers ($90)

In case you were searching for a classic take on bloomers, look no further than this gingham pair. Not only do they have an elastic waistband for a comfortable fit, they also feature side seam pockets, adding a functional touch.

Best Denim Bloomer Shorts

Suzie Kondi Hera Bloomers Linen-Chambray Shorts ($165)

If you're a denim lover, these cotton shorts are a summer must have. The roomy silhouette and lightweight chambray fabric make these a comfortable warm-weather piece. Whether it's a casual party or a post-beach look, you're bound to feel your most confident.

Best Bloomer Skirt

Aknvas x Revolve Aja Bloomer Skirt ($295)

Fashion is in the era of multiuse items, and this bloomer-meets-skirt hybrid is a prime example. The design isn't only a fully-lined bloomer, but it comes with a pleated skirt overlay, allowing you to get more coverage than you would with just shorts. Style the look with a crop top or deconstructed tank, and you're ready for any summer escapade.

Best Designer Bloomer Shorts

Miu Miu Technical Silk Briefs ($1,150)

In the mood to splurge? Consider these bloomers from Miu Miu. From the brand's iconic logo patch to the high cut, you'll want to wear these solo with a blazer and heels or layered under some baggy jeans with sneakers. They're also made of high-quality technical silk, meaning they'll be a long-lasting wardrobe essential.

Naomi Parris is the assistant shopping editor at PS, based in New York. With over eight years of experience and previous roles held on the brand's Beauty and Operations teams, she enjoys telling stories that merge fashion, beauty, and Black culture. Naomi has also lent her skillful pen to Essence Girls United, Elle, Bustle, and Elite Daily. When she's not crafting shopping roundups, high-profile features, beauty op-eds, or trend guides, you can find Naomi behind her blog "Eli-Nay," where she inspires readers through style guides, cultural pieces, and innovative content on her Instagram.
